column5: Thanks Roy for letting us know about Gary's passing, although this is very sad news.  Leslie and I always looked forward to seeing Gary at the OFC weekends and were sad when he could not make it up the last couple of years due to poor health.  According to all the tributes here on the board he was very well loved and respected. Some of these posts are from folks we have not heard of for some time. Its good to see and read their thoughts.  Our condolences to all of Gary's family and friends.   The problem about having friends is that someday we all have to say good-bye! And although sad, it is not so sad as the alternative.    Kevin and Leslie and family.

Very sad news indeed.  Although I never had the chance to meet Gary, I enjoyed his posts.  He certainly added a lot to our community here and will be greatly missed by many.  My condolences to his family and friends.
our thought go out to Garys family sorry to here of there loss
Rest in Pease enjoyed your post's and comments
My sincerest condolences goes out to his family and friends.
My condolences, from what I have read over the years Gary was a great man. Even offered personal advice on many occasions.  In peace Gary, have a great time out on the big lake.
So sorry to be reading this post.As a fellow Blue Water Angler....my sincere condolences.
That is very sad. Condolences to Gary's family.
It's sad to hear.I enjoyed many of Gary's post and advise. My Condolences go out to Gary's family and Friends. Dan
Another sad moment, condolences to his family.
Very sad news.  Condolences to Gary's family.
....Met Gary back in 2002 at the first G2G and I know I'll miss is presence. Always an even keel even during stormy times. God bless you Gary.
Very sad to read about the passing of Gary.  Our thoughts and condolences are with you and your family  John and Diane Ross

Sorry to hear of his passing I found out this morning from Bill at Silv'ry Moon Lodge. Gary loved to go there ,loved the lake and was always a participant at our London Swills,His favourite was the Brontosaurus burger at Final Score,His advice and caring while I was sick and words of encouragement will always be remembered.my condolences to his family, Brian
He will be missed. My condolences to his family.
Truly sad news indeed, my deepest condolences to Gary's family. May he rest in Peaceful fishing pond in the heavens.
Thanks TJ for the candle on behalf of all of us at OFC.
Just got back from London (back to school for daughter) - wow ... so sad to hear !  My deepest condolences to the family !
this is very sad news indeed, i always enjoyed his post.  best wishes to his family and loved ones.   jason
Although I am sure many know of this...  Here is Gary's website.. a little insight into the man  http://xcelco.on.ca/~vacek/

I am stunned!! I just read Gary's last post the other day.  I know its already been posted, but his personal statement is something we should all take to heart every day.  If life was simply a bowl of cherries we would probably start looking for the pits, enjoy life, treasure the good times, keep the good memories with you, and whenever possible live your life to the fullest.  I never had the pleasure of meeting him personally (my loss), but it is like I knew him.  Its not often that you shed tears for someone you've never personally met.  Thank you OFC for some of the wonderful people we would not otherwise meet.  Rest in peace my friend.
Thanks for the post bud , very nice website
Too much bad news going around lately. My condolences.
Condolences to Gary's family and friends. I've always enjoyed his posts and have learned alot from them.  Gary, you'll be missed here. RIP.

My condolences to Garys family and friends.  *edit* I must add that this comment on his web site is something I think we all share. Reflection: Water can reflect it's own tranquility and the beauty of nature. While fishing one can reflect on both
All I could add at this point, after all these heartfelt tributes, is  Thanks, Gary.  Rest well.  We are poorer for your passing.

I never got to meet Gary personally, but he was one of the first to give encoursgement during my recent Prostate problem. A very generous man in more ways than one, as many Members can attest RIP Gary, and my heartfelt condolences to his family.
Holy cow.  I always paid special attention to his posts, mainly reading one a few days ago.  He seemed like a genuine guy.  My condolences to his family and friends.  I still can't believe it.
Condolences to his family and friends also, sad news. RIP Gary.
Very sad news .. my condolences
Sad news. My deepest condolances to his family, he will be missed.
Very sad news indeed, Gary was one of the most helpful and insightful people on this board. He will be missed for sure. My condolences to his family and friends.

Wow! I am shocked! Just like many of us here I didn't realize Gary's time was about up.  Although I never had the honour of shaking Gary's hand I had the great fortune of receiving and sending several PM's with him over the years. I feel a friend has been lost and I shed a tear for him this morning.  May you rest peacefully and catch many, many fish in your everlasting fishing adventure you have just begun.
That is sad news. My condolences to his family and friends.

While we all have lost a good friend and a man who has wisdom... We  can take our memories and hold them forever. My condolences to Gary's family that he has left behind and the friends that grieve for their loss.   Art
Very least we could, an online tribute was fitting....
Gary, Rest In Peace. My sincerest condolences to his family.
Must have been a great guy. Being an OFNer and fisherman, wish I could have met him. My condolences to the family.

I am shocked! I had been Pming Gary occasionally to find out how he was doing. I to, was under the impression that he licked the illness he had earlier this year and I stopped PMing... now, this news. I had only joined up to this board for about 6 months, when I posted that I was going to be in the Grand Bend area for a week and if any OFNer lived in the area and wanted someone to fish with, I'd be happy to join them. Well, Gary contacted me quickly. He lived in Lampton Shores, a short drive from where we were staying. We met up, I was introduced to his wife and his Amy, and off we went to chase some smallies. Now, here's a testament to the quality of man he was... the lake was angry that day. 3-4 footers rolling into the area that Gary fishes. I know for a fact that he would have turned around and gone home to his family if it weren't for me being there, but he said, what the heck Joe, this is the only open day I have to get out, so let's give it a try. We tried for a few hours, nothin doing, but the time I spent with Gary is time I will always remember. Gary had run his own businesses and had his feet firmly planted on the ground. He was the kind of person who you could ask for advice and know for a fact that the advice coming back would be sound. His love for his family was evident in every conversation. He shared his knowledge of props to anyone who asked. Man, I am still in shock... we've lost a good one. My sincere condolences to his family and friends. We will miss him. HH
Sad very sad news indeed.   I was shocked when i logged in and saw this post.  My condolences .

Very sad to hear this news. I always appreciated Gary's caring and wisdom when responding to board members questions or problems they were having. My thoughts and prayers are with Gary's family and friends.  Sincerely, 1leg

My deepest condolence to Gary's family and friends. If you visit Gary's profile you can read his personal statement "If life was simply a bowl of cherries we would probably start looking for the pits, enjoy life, treasure the good times, keep the good memories with you, and whenever possible live your life to the fullest."

Wow, I don't even know what to say.   I'm just shocked.  Gary helped me so much when I needed him a few years ago and I'll never forget that.  My sincerest condolances to his family at this time.  Joey
I'm shocked to hear this, I thought he was on the mend.  Talked to him many times through Pm's but unfortunately never got to meet him. My deepest condolences to his family.  Jim

What a shock.... He has offered me advice on more then one occasion.. an probably the most sound advice I received... He will be missed by many here from along time to come..  Lord, please watch over our friend, Let his fish all be trophies and plentiful..  My condolences to Gary's family  G
Very sad news. My condolences to his family.

Ahhh jeez, that's lousy news.  We just got in from celebrating my wifes birthday and I checked my email and found the message from David and was just about to post it here.  Gary was without doubt one of the nicest people we've ever had on OFC and I've considered him a good friend for a very long time. We've exchanged many PM's and emails over the years and have talked on the phone many times with alot of our discussions being about his beloved dog Amy and my dog Marvin.  His specialty around here was outboard motor propellers and he's helped out many many OFC members with their propeller problems.  Gary will be sadly missed by those of us that knew him well and to those of you who never had the pleasure of knowing him, you missed out on a wonderful person.  Rest in peace my friend and my very deepest condolances to your loved ones.
This is awful news. My condolences to his friends and family both on and off the board. His posts always had something useful to share.  Definite loss to OFC.  RIP
sad to hear ,  My condolences to his family
Terrible terrible news. My condolences to Garys family and friends. He will be missed.
I too was able to meet Gary at Lakair in '06 a very nice guy indeed who had much to contribute here
I was very sorry to receive this news. I met Gary at the first Lakeair trip in 2002 and we have stayed in touch ever since. My condolences to all. Garry2Rs

WOW,  I am saddened by this news.  Gary helped me out a few times through some exchanges by mail and PM.  He gave more than he got, a trait that not many any more can duplicate.  RIP, I hope Amy was happy to see you.
Rest in Peace Gary, you will be greatly missed by all of us.  Deepest condolences to the family, our families thoughts and prayers are with you.
My condolences to his family
This is a shock to be sure.My best to the family.He is with his best friend now. Joe
Hard to beleive he's gone...... My condolences go out to Gary and his family.....

Roy, I just read your post and perhaps the next 2 but Im not going to go through the next few pages for a moment, I dont post much but ............... THIS FREAKING SUCKS................. Gary was a friend to not only me but my family and we are going to miss him. Indeed this is sad news and I thank you for the umpleasant chore of bringing this to our attention. To Gary's son............if you read this... Our heart felt sincere sympathy goes out to you at this time and your family.  My last time with Gary was at Lakair, (west arm of Lake Nippissing, Ontario), in /06 .......... and he graced our campfire every night we were there and you couldnt find better company anywhere, This is a sad day in our home........... ..........we will rejoice in his memory ............NO PROBLEMS AT ALL!  Thanks Roy.......thanks.

From our family to Gary's.  Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace! That where there is hatred, I may bring love. That where there is wrong, I may bring the spirit of forgiveness. That where there is discord, I may bring harmony. That where there is error, I may bring truth. That where there is doubt, I may bring faith. That where there is despair, I may bring hope. That where there are shadows, I may bring light. That where there is sadness, I may bring joy. Lord, grant that I may seek rather to comfort, than to be comforted. To understand, than to be understood. To love, than to be loved. For it is by self-forgetting that one finds. It is by forgiving that one is forgiven. It is by dying that one awakens to Eternal Life.  Splashhopper and Botbot
Rest in Peace
Sad, so sad.  My condolences to Gary's family and friends.  Rest In Peace Gary

Just FYI - the funeral home's online tribute page for Gary has gone live.  Click on his name, it'll launch a window with candles on it.  The "service details / tribute" button is at the bottom of this candle page.  http://www.dodgefuneralhome.com/runtime.ph...vigatorId=29209
My deepest condolences to his family and friends !!

My sincerest sympathies go out to his family.  He was one of the first OFNer's I ever met way back at the first Lakair G2G but I've known him much longer than that through the board.   He's was here almost since the beginning and he was one of the nicest and classiest guys around.  I will miss him.
Heres the direct link to the tribute page HERE

It's with the greatest sorrow that I must announce the passing of Gary Vacek this morning.  This email was sent to several members a few minutes ago.  First of all my name  is David Vacek, Gary's son.  I am writing this e-mail for my mother and the rest  of the family to inform all family and friends of my Dad's that he passed away  this morning.  Arrangements are being made for a memorial service in Forest,  Ontario and will be published in Saturday's Sarnia Observer and next weeks  Forest Standard.  An online tribute will be posted shortly at http://www.dodgefuneralhome.com/runtime.ph...vigatorId=29209
That's a tough loss.  Gary was a great guy and will be missed.
to bad wishing sincere condolences to the family
Dang!!!!  I'm sorry to hear that, he was a heck of a guy!  He'll be with Amy and her predacessors now  Thanks for letting us know Roy  My condolences to Gary's family  Maureen
what was Gary's board name ?
GaryV
Very sorry to hear of this. He will be missed. My condolences to his family.
Very sad news, condolences to his family and friends. I will miss his post. God Bless.
What terrible news.  Jeff's & my condolences to Gary's loved ones.  He was just here last night.  Not that that makes a difference when it's your time, but it feels significant somehow.
My condolences to his family. I have not been around as long as some of you guys have but I dont remember seeing Gary ever say a bad words towards anyone on here.

OMG, thats terrible news, Gary was a very long time member of this board, back to the very beginning.  I spoke with him on the phone frequently during the early days of the board, and he helped to calm me down when there was "trouble".   He was a wise, kind and generous gentleman and I will miss him.

Just got in from being on the lake and read my e-mail...Dang  Maribeth and I send our condolences to Gary's family...  I only met Gary in person once up at Lakair three years ago and spent a pleasant afternoon with him and Amy out in his boat...it turns out we had a lot in common besides our love of fishing...I'll miss our exchange of e-mails...

Our condolences to his family. I cant believe that a day of joy for our family with our first grandchild,comes with a loss of a friend. Some say,when one goes,another arrives. We here, will be grateful of both lives  tonight.
Terrible news, codolences from both Joanne and myself.
Such sad sad news. My condolences to his family. I remember how happy Gary was when he got his new Border Collie pup just about a month and a half ago.

Yeah .. I remember posts from GaryV.  Huge loss to the family and I extend my deepest condolences.  It's alwso a huge loss to OFC.  I'm sure GaryV will be missed by many.    Rest in PEACE my friend ... rest in PEACE.
I'm sorry to hear that. I didn't know him personally but his comments and insights were always worth reading here.  JF
My condolences to Gary's family  Rob

My deepest condolences to his family and friends, he will be sorely be missed on this board.  I met Gary at the last Lakair G2G he attended, he was really a great guy in person just like on the board!!!  Rest in Peace Gary, we will miss you!
Damn...thats sad he will be missed Rest in Peace.

I just got in the door to grab a bite to eat and saw this thread. What a terrible feeling!  Gary will be missed by many besides his bilogical family, he was a truly a wonderful person.  My condolances to his family and friends!

oh man that's a bummer for sure man - he was a solid guy and will be missed by many including myself - he gave me some sound advice on more than one occasion.  My condolences to his family and friends!
What a shame..  He'll be sorely missed.  My deepest sympathies to his family.  God Speed.  HD

This is terrible news!!!  Gary just posted yesterday...hard to believe.  I knew he has had some health problems, but it sounded like he was on the mend.  He will be missed greatly....our condolences go out to his family, and all who knew him.  Cliff and Carole.

I'm terribly sorry to hear this... I enjoyed his posts, and was on the recieving end of some great advice in the past from him as well. He was an honest, generous and grounded member...its a sad day for the OFC
